title: Input signal out of range: use 1600 x 900- 60 HZ error
body: After champ select and the game goes to loading screen, I get a black screen and this error. I cannot get into the game and play. I have tried adjusting the screen size to this in display settings and it didn't work, I've tried re-installing the game, and run repairs on League and nothing works. I've never had this issue before and haven't been able to find solutions on the internet. Please help, thanks.

replies.body:
Most of the time that happens because you're trying to play League on a larger resolution than your monitor can handle. If you weren't able to fix it by adjusting the resolution settings, try completely resetting your config options following these steps.

- Log into the game client
- Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\
- Delete the folder named **Config**
- Go into a practice game and verify that settings have saved properly. 
- Leave game to sync settings

This solution did not work for me, do you have any other methods of trying to fix it? I've been playing for about 6 years now and have been using this monitor frequently without ever having an issue before.

Hmmmm strange, this might be something entirely different causing the issue then. Go ahead and reach out to our techs in a [**ticket**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new). They'll be able to look through some of your game logs to see exactly what's going wrong.
